channel.title: Basic Object Configuration Format
channel.description:
So I woke up this morning and got a little bored. I looked through the client and found out how some of the object configuration is loaded from the loc.dat. There's enough here to make your own object without hard coding, if I'm not mistaken.
Download it as a MS Word file, or HTML file. I don't have a site to put the HTML one on. It's not perfect, and there's still stuff to figure out like textures (Not many objects use external textures anyways), animations, etc... But this is what I came up with.
~Lin

item.title: Basic Object Configuration Format
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

This doesn’t tell you anything about the variables inside the class… This is for when you open the cache’s loc.dat, and it tells you what each byte does. Once changing them, you can repack it, and no hardcoding done.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Object Configuration Format
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

your own object without hard coding, if I'm not mistaken.

What is your definition of hard-coding? Because listing the varaibles and what they do doesn’t remove hard-coding.

Read full topic
